STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 4, 2021
Scott Parrott
Gogebic Iron Ontonagon DHHS
301 E. Lead Street
Bessemer, MI 49911
RE: License #: CP270201149
Gogebic Iron Ontonagon DHHS
301 E. Lead Street
Bessemer, MI 49911
Dear Mr. Parrott:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/04/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP (Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan). The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or MISEP citation.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not achieve
compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child
in a foster home, then both of the following shall be
documented before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up
to the time of the change in placement and the needs that
remain to be met.
Two of 2 closed foster care services files reviewed did not have a summary of the
services provided during care up to the time of the change in placement and the
needs that remain to be met.
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION: 2020 Interim Inspection with approved CAP on
7/28/2020.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child
in a foster home, then both of the following shall be
documented before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
Two of 2 closed foster care services files reviewed did not have a provision for any
continuing services.
THIS IS A REPEAT VIOLATION: 2020 Interim Inspection with approved CAP on
7/28/2020.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of 11 foster care services files reviewed did not have updated services plans in
compliance with the above rule. One was 10 days beyond the 90 days of this rule
and the other was 1 day.
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements except for the following:
JJM 270 JUVENILE JUSTICE SPECIALIST CONTACT
Page 2 of 7 REQUIREMENTS.
Residential The first face-to-face contact with the youth must take place
Placement within five business days from admission.
The JJS must have at least one face-to-face contact with the
youth each calendar month at his/her placement location.
One of 11 services files reviewed did not have a face to face contact as required by
the above policy. The youth was placed in a Child Caring Institution on 03/22/2021
and there was not a face to face meeting recorded in MiSACWIS from 03/22/2021 to
05/03/2021. There was a video conference on 04/29/2021.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. A corrective action plan was approved on
07/28/2020 to address violations during the interim inspection. The agency was cited
for: R 400.12324 Reevaluation and R 400.12405 Change of placement, which is a
repeat violation.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
May 4, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 4, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
